subsection.name: What type of data objects are supported?
subsection.p: Dozer uses reflection to access data object properties, so it is designed to work with "dumb" data objects that have corresponding getter and setter methods for it's fields. For example, a data object that has a field named "message" should have a getMessage and setMessage method. Data objects that don't follow this pattern are also supported, but will most likely require a custom mapping definition. For these unorthodox data objects, you can tell Dozer to directly access fields(including private) and/or explicitly specify which get/set methods to use.

subsection.name: Will Dozer automatically perform data type conversions?
subsection.p: Yes. Most scenarios are supported out of box. These include primitives, Java Wrapper Objects, Number subclasses, Dates, Calendar, Collections, Arrays, Maps, and Complex types
